articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary: Microplastic exposure in humans alters gut microbiome composition, potentially increasing bacterial diversity linked to disease risks and disrupting beneficial bacterial populations.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a modified albumin-based nanoparticle delivery system for paclitaxel that improves colloidal stability, resulting in enhanced tumor drug exposure and efficacy.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary: Manipulating gut microbiome diversity through fecal transplants, probiotics, and diet may improve immunotherapy responses in urothelial carcinoma patients.
